result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew McKenzie

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Motion in Limine received and filed.  bm

Defendant Andrew McKenzie in court.  Attorney Rebecca M Coffee in court for Andrew McKenzie.  Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of all discovery and requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  State will hold offer open until the final pre-trial date.  Court advised parties that final pre-trial date may be converted to plea hearing if defendant decides to plead.  Court further advised that all plea paperwork shall be submitted by November 4, 2022.  Case adjourned to Branch 45, Rm G55A.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew McKenzie in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee, both parties appear via zoom.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person.  Parties before the court regarding defense motion to modify bail.  Amy K. read statement.  The State opposes any modification of bail.   Additional statements by parties.  The Courts order is as follows:  Because victim and defendant attend the same high school, there may be incidental contact between the parties.  However, the defendant is to have NO PARTICIPATION in Band, defendant is prohibited from having any verbal, visual or physical contact with the victim, H.K.  Case is adjourned in Br 45 for scheduling.  mn  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification, filed.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB

Defendant Andrew McKenzie in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Andrew McKenzie appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court grants defense request for adjourned status.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew McKenzie in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense bail motion argued and denied.  Defendant admonished that violations of the current no-contact order will result in setting a cash-bail.  Defense awaiting offer and discovery.   Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.   kmw

Defendant Andrew McKenzie in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  FILED, Preliminary hearing questionnaire & waiver.    Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court finds probable cause.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 6:00 P.M. ON (5/15/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with H.K. 2/28/2007.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Andrew McKenzie in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on May 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Rebecca Coffee called and informed the court that she will have to reschedule due to exposure of Covid. Court date for 4/29/2022 has been vacated and rescheduled to 5/13/2022, at 1:30 p.m.

Adjustment Number: 22A 036702,
Payable Number: 1000088,
Receipt Number: 22RP015413,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/29/2022@01:00pm
